page.title: 05The Landslip-the GEOLOGY
page.content: Starting from{Shanklin Chine}the cliff is made up of porous sandstone and impervious rock.At the top is porous rock and a hard bed of impervous rock.The porous rock lets water pass through and impervious doesn't let water pass through. When it is quite windy the sand blows into the air and hits the cliff and it knocks off another bit of sand.Just before{Horse Ledge}there was a bit of cliff had got wet and it had fallen off and made a cone and there are many fossils to be found here.To the south at{Luccombe Bay}there is a cliff that had slipped and got wet and there is a mud flow now.At{Luccombe Chine}is a path that leads to{the Landslip},which is an area of rotational slip.It is a very interesting place to visit.
